filmography.title: June Bride
filmography.role_description: An uncredited debut role as a friend of the bride in this Bette Davis comedy.
filmography.plot: A magazine editor and her former flame cover a 'typical American wedding' in winter, but complications ensue.

filmography.title: Three Little Words
filmography.role_description: The real-life 'Boop-Oop-a-Doop' singer, portrayed by Reynolds in a breakout musical performance.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of the Tin Pan Alley songwriting partnership of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Most Promising Newcomer

filmography.title: Two Weeks with Love
filmography.role_description: A feisty teenager on vacation who sings the hit duet 'Aba Daba Honeymoon' with Carleton Carpenter.
filmography.plot: In the early 1900s, a teenager on vacation tries to woo a handsome older man while dealing with her parents' restrictions.

filmography.title: Singin' in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A talented chorus girl who captures a movie star's heart and dubs the voice of his screechy leading lady.
filmography.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

filmography.title: I Love Melvin
filmography.role_description: An aspiring Broadway actress who is promised a cover shoot for 'Look' magazine by a photographer's assistant.
filmography.plot: A photographer's assistant promises to put a chorus girl on the cover of Look magazine to win her heart.

filmography.title: The Affairs of Dobie Gillis
filmography.role_description: The crush of the titular character in this college comedy based on Max Shulman's stories.
filmography.plot: Dobie Gillis and his friend Maynard G. Krebs chase girls and get into trouble at Grainbelt University.

filmography.title: Susan Slept Here
filmography.role_description: A juvenile delinquent who is dropped off at a bachelor screenwriter's apartment for the holidays.
filmography.plot: A screenwriter takes in a wayward teenager during Christmas to study her for a script, leading to romance.

filmography.title: The Tender Trap
filmography.role_description: A determined young actress who sets her sights on marrying a swinging bachelor agent.
filmography.plot: A theatrical agent with a bevy of girlfriends finds his bachelor lifestyle threatened when he falls for a woman with a plan for marriage.

filmography.title: The Catered Affair
filmography.role_description: A bride-to-be caught between her desire for a small wedding and her mother's wish for a lavish event.
filmography.plot: A working-class mother fights to give her daughter an expensive wedding, causing tension with her husband.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Bundle of Joy
filmography.role_description: A salesgirl who finds an abandoned baby and is mistakenly believed to be the mother by her boss's son.
filmography.plot: A salesgirl discovers a foundling baby and is presumed to be the mother by her employer's son, leading to romance.

filmography.title: Tammy and the Bachelor
filmography.role_description: A sweet, naive backwoods girl who nurses a pilot back to health and falls in love; features her hit song 'Tammy'.
filmography.plot: A bayou girl nurses a crashed pilot back to health and later visits him at his plantation home.

filmography.title: This Happy Feeling
filmography.role_description: A young secretary who flees an amorous employer and takes refuge with a retired actor.
filmography.plot: A retired actor is reinvigorated when a young woman seeks shelter in his home to escape her lecherous boss.

filmography.title: The Mating Game
filmography.role_description: A farm girl whose eccentric family is investigated by a tax agent, who ends up falling for her.
filmography.plot: A tax agent investigates a chaotic farm family who haven't paid taxes in years, only to fall in love with their daughter.

filmography.title: It Started with a Kiss
filmography.role_description: A showgirl who marries a soldier and moves to Spain, where their relationship is tested.
filmography.plot: After a whirlwind courtship and marriage, an Air Force sergeant and his new wife try to make their relationship work in Spain.

filmography.title: The Gazebo
filmography.role_description: The Broadway star wife of a writer who tries to cover up a murder and bury the body in their backyard.
filmography.plot: A writer creates a gazebo to hide the body of a blackmailer he accidentally killed.

filmography.title: The Rat Race
filmography.role_description: A cynical dancer who shares an apartment with a naive musician in New York City.
filmography.plot: A jazz musician and a dancer share a small apartment in New York City, supporting each other through hard times.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A showgirl and pioneer who travels west, marries a gambler, and inherits a gold mine.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush and the Civil War.

filmography.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
filmography.role_description: The boisterous, rags-to-riches survivor of the Titanic; Reynolds' only Oscar-nominated performance.
filmography.plot: A poor, uneducated mountain girl leaves her cabin in search of a wealthy husband and a better life.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress

filmography.title: Goodbye Charlie
filmography.role_description: A womanizing writer who is reincarnated as a woman and must adjust to life in a female body.
filmography.plot: A womanizer is shot by a jealous husband and reincarnated as a woman, forced to see life from the other side.

filmography.title: The Singing Nun
filmography.role_description: A Belgian nun who becomes an international pop sensation with her song 'Dominique'.
filmography.plot: A Belgian nun writes a song that becomes a worldwide hit, but she struggles to reconcile her fame with her vows.

filmography.title: Divorce American Style
filmography.role_description: A wealthy suburban wife who drifts into divorce, satirizing the social mores of the 1960s.
filmography.plot: After 17 years of marriage, a couple divorces and finds that the single life isn't what they expected.

filmography.title: What's the Matter with Helen?
filmography.role_description: A dance teacher in 1930s Hollywood who tries to hide from a scandalous past while her partner descends into madness.
filmography.plot: Two women whose sons were convicted of a notorious murder move to Hollywood to open a talent school.

filmography.title: Charlotte's Web
filmography.role_description: The wise and kind spider who saves a pig named Wilbur in this animated classic.
filmography.plot: A gentle spider befriends a pig and weaves words into her web to save him from slaughter.

filmography.title: Mother
filmography.role_description: An eccentric mother who moves in with her adult son, meddling in his life and analyzing his failures.
filmography.plot: A neurotic writer moves back in with his mother to solve his personal problems, leading to a clash of wills.

filmography.title: In & Out
filmography.role_description: The bewildered mother of a high school teacher who is outed as gay on national television during the Oscars.
filmography.plot: A midwestern teacher questions his sexuality after a former student makes a shocking announcement at the Academy Awards.

filmography.title: Halloweentown
filmography.role_description: A powerful witch who reveals to her grandchildren that they come from a line of magic users.
filmography.plot: A young girl discovers her grandmother is a witch and follows her to Halloweentown to save it from evil.

filmography.title: Behind the Candelabra
filmography.role_description: The controlling mother of the pianist Liberace; Reynolds' final film appearance.
filmography.plot: Based on the autobiographical novel, the tempestuous six-year relationship between Liberace and his (much younger) lover, Scott Thorson, is recounted.
